Description: Wall sherd of small Attic black-figured pottery kantharos with part of cul; interior glazed shiny black with added red band in groove at cul; exterior: black-figure procession to right, lower parts preserved: on left, figure in calf-length chiton and mantle added red, holding staff; to right, figure in ankle-length chiton, with red on upper part and on central panel of skirt, and mantle with red on right hanging end); at left, part of rosette with red on one leaf; below panel, band in red; then a plastic fillet with row of dots (slanting right) on it; below fillet, band of stepped zigzags and line below; on cul, three lines with staggered dots below.
Producer name: Attributed to the Manner of: The KX Painter
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.445. For the band of decoration below the scene, compare the kantharos fragments, Alexandria 9383 and 17206 (Venit 1988, pl. 65, nos. 290 a and b).
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.44)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 256, no. 13)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 354, no. B450)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 227, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0735) (Phase 1)
